alert.note: Alert for Grand (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 04 at 6:36PM MDT until July 04 at 9:15PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 945 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of north central Colorado, including the following county, Grand. * WHEN...Until 945 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 636 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause small stream flooding. Up to 0.5 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Kinney Creek, Soda Creek, Willow Creek, Onahu Creek, Middle Fork Creek, Monument Creek, Ethel Creek, Corral Creek, Buffalo Creek, Trail Creek, Wheatley Creek, Round Creek, East Branch Willow Creek, Gold Run, Drowsy Water Creek, East Fork Troublesome Creek, Trout Creek, Troublesome Creek, North Fork Cabin Creek and Cabin Creek. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Grand Lake. - This includes the following additional locations... Lower Stillwater Creek, Stillwater Pass, Upper Willow Creek Valley, Middle Willow Creek Valley, Lower Willow Creek Valley, Remote East Troublesome Headwaters, East Troublesome Valley and Upper Corral Creek Valley.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Heavy Rainfall will cause minor flooding of small creeks, streams, and ditches in the East Troublesome burn area. The heavy rains could also trigger rock slides or debris flows.
